summary:
My experience is that ICT services have often become unnecessarily complex in recent years. Also, too much time is spent on activities that do not add value to the customer. DevOps can make changes by working together with development and operation teams to generate value for the customer. In this context, cooperation and knowledge sharing are central to me. My specialties include DevOps, Agile Scrum, Acceptance Criteria, Service Architecture, Chain Management, SLAs and Risk Management. I am a knowledge worker who likes to transform knowledge in knowhow, publishes experiences, compiles and carries out training and finally assesses the acquired knowledge and skills in the form of exams and audits.

Some examples of my knowledge cycle are:
• Set up the One Agile Way of Working for Plint AB which includes four value systems ( business, development, operations and information security) in which the value streams and use cases are defined. This OAWOW is certified for ISO 27001:2013. To train the Plint employees I have created the Plint Academy which includes 36 workshops and exams to become a green, organge and black belt Plint Engineer. Based on this OAWOW many tenders have been won for Plint AB. 
• Creating DevOps teams for Finance and Riks at ING, including the required best practices.
• Using an agile approach to improve processes at Philips DPS, ANVA, PON IT and UMG ICT.
• Inspecting Agile Service Management in practice within ten organizations.
• Publication of two Agile Service Management books.
• Writing and performing DevOps Master train the trainer sessions in China, Malaysia and the Netherlands.
• Writing and performing DevOps Fundamental, DevOps Operations, DevOps Development, DevOps Architecture, DevOps Master and DevOps in practice trainings.
• Write and perform an Agile Service Management training.
• Audits of DevOps training and training institutes.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

publications.name: Artikel: Continuous Delivery Vraagt om Continous Auditing

profile_positions.description: Coaching the tender team regarding the new service organisation set-up and the required migration of HMS information systems.
profile_positions.title: Tender coach

profile_positions.description:
Based on my DevOps experiences in the past 10 year I have created the Continuous Everything (CE) concept that consists of Continuous Planning, Continuous Design, Continuous Testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Monitoring, Continuous Learning, Continuous Auditing, Continuous Security, Continuous Assessment and more to follow. 

For each component a practical training is created by the CE Guild. This Guild consists of CE trainers with expertise in one or more CE trainings. All CE trainings are performed as master classes by IT Management Group and consist of both in dept knowledge as well as hands-on exercises.

Each of these master classes is offered with a related CE book and an online exam. The trainings are offered both classroom based as well as e-learning.

profile_positions.title: REACT EU at ITMG

profile_positions.description:
The assignment was about assisting the newly established DMI organization to create the DevOps audit community standard T/CIE 186-2023. This standard is approved by the Chinese certification institute called CIE. T/CIE stands for: Tuan Ti 团体 Chinese Institute of Electronics. The CIE organization approves three levels of standards in China: the community standards the industry standards and the national standards.

Based on this standard, DMI will performs DevOps audits in order to certificate for five levels of DevOps maturity per DevOps capability like Continuous Testing. The following entities can be certified: 
•	DevOps Teams: DevOps maturity level certification for each DevOps capability. 
•	DevOps Organisation: DevOps maturity level certification for each DevOps capability.
 
DMI also trains DevOps professionals to get certified for the following DevOps Certifications of DMI/Exin:
1.	DevOps Foundation certificate
2.	DevOps Professional certificate
3.	DevOps Master certificate
 
In order to accomplish this the standard, the following actions have been performed:
1.	Publication of eleven Continuous Everything books in Dutch and English. 
2.	Creation of the Continuous Audit tool in Dutch and English by which DevOps teams and DevOps organizations can be audited. DMI translated the tool into the Chinese Language.
3.	Performing pilot audits with the audit tool for DevOps teams in The Netherlands (JustID) and China (Lenovo and CiCC). 
4.	Hand-over the first T/CIE 186-2023 certificates during DevOps days in Beijing.
5.	Presented the way of working of the DevOps audit in Beijing during the DevOps days and during the Top Innovation Depth (TiD) days.
6.	Launching the Chinese edition of the books Continuous Everything and Continuous Controls during the DevOps days in Beijing which are publishing by TUP (Tsing Hua University Press)
7.	Signing the newly released Continuous Everything books during the TiD days.
8.	Supporting the DMI certification programme

profile_positions.title: DevOps Master

profile_positions.location: Capelle aan den IJssel, South Holland, Netherlands
profile_positions.description: This assignment was about the migration of a financial system from a business perspective. The activities included the definition of business requirements in the Gherkin language format, the consistency checking of requirements with the high level and detailed designs, the data migration designs, the testcases and other migration related work.
profile_positions.title: DevOps Architect

profile_positions.description:
This assignment is about:
- Boost the velocity of the development team by eliminating fragility, technical deb and waste and establish a DevOps Way of Working which includes: 
- Reverse engineering the Plint application into the Plint Value System by introducing the following models: Business Canvas model, Value Stream model, Value Stream Canvas model, Use Case Diagram.
- Introducing requirement management using: Use Case and Given-When-Then
- Establishing the Development Value System, Service Value System and Information Security Value System using the same models as the Plint Value System
- Introducing the Plint Enterprise Architecture using: Architecture Principles and Architecture Models like the System Building Blocks models
- Introducing the DevOps principles and best practices like: The three ways of Gene Kim, CI/CD Secure Pipeline BDD and TDD
- Establishing the Plint Academy to fasten the onboarding Plint programmers at Plint
- Enabling the certification of ISO 27001:2013
- Training and Coaching the DevOps team to become DevOps Engineering professionals
profile_positions.title: DevOps Architect

profile_positions.description: The goal of this 6 workshops is to prepare the service delivery team of Datapunt for the coming period of time. In the first workshop we defined the value stream of Datapunt and obtained a view on the software delivery process. On the second day we defined a technical debt backlog by brain storming and using the Gherkin BDD language to define the improvements. The third and fourth day we analysed the VSM Cube for one of the services to gain a more in dept technical backlog. On day 5 we we scanned the DevOps maturity in order to be able to plot a DevOps improvement dashboard.
profile_positions.title: DevOps Coach

profile_positions.description:
During this assignment I performed a value stream mapping for nine applications and enabled improvements in the transparency and traceability of the software delivery pipeline by writing and performing several series of workshops. 

The results are DevOps improvement dashboards, technical debt backlog, hands on work shops for  Agile Test Management (BDD and TDD) and Agile Design, the establishment of two guilds, and the training of two coaches to embed the improvements in the organisation.
profile_positions.title: DevOps Coach

profile_positions.description: ITMG assignment to coach the process managers of  Gemeente Amsterdam to apply agile service management.  This includes the requirement based process design approach in combination with an  Agile Scrum based CSI process.
